column1: Data on activities of multinational enterprises
U.S. Direct Investment Abroad,All U.S. Parent Companies (data for 2009 and forward),Research and Development Expenditures
By Industry of U.S. Parent Company (NAICS) (Millions of Dollars)
Resins and synthetic rubber, fibers, and filaments
Soap, cleaning compounds, and toilet preparations
Motor vehicles, bodies and trailers, and parts
Professional and commercial equipment and supplies
Motion picture and sound recording industries
Data processing, hosting, and related services
Computer systems design and related services
Real estate and rental and leasing
Management of nonbank companies and enterprises
n.s. Not shown. Data may not be shown for several reasons:
• The data appear on another line in this table.
• The data are not shown in this table but may be available in detailed country- or industry-level tables in this interactive system or in other BEA published tables on direct investment.
• The data are not available, do not apply, or are not defined.
(*) A nonzero value that rounds to zero.
(D) indicates that the data in the cell have been suppressed to avoid disclosure of data of individual companies.
Source: U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis

Data users should be aware that the increase in most U.S. MNE activities from 2013 to 2014 appears to largely reflect the improved coverage of these activities in the 2014 Benchmark Survey of U.S. Direct Investment Abroad. For more information see Improvements in Coverage.
If you have a question about the availability of data, E-mail your question to internationalaccounts@bea.gov
